conclusion: Given: Mass of each log, m = 10 kg; Radius of the section, R = 0.1 m; Angle of the isosceles triangle, ∠O1 = 120°; Acceleration due to gravity, g = 9.8 m/s².
Calculate the normal force acting on each log: N = m * g = 98 N.
Calculate the frictional force acting on each log: F = μs * N.
Calculate the coefficient of static friction: F = (1/2) * N = 49 N; μs = F / N = 0.5.
Calculate the dynamic friction factor: μk = μs = 0.5.
